author: catwith1hat
content: <@539495253418180618> Is it possible to have withdrawals go through the deposit contract? Of course, the deposit contract would need to be redeployed to support that, but I found the withdrawal method = "the creation of ETH out of thin air with no connection to the deposit process" somewhat weird. If people keep hoping in and out, and in and out of staking, the deposit contract will nominally acquire an ever-increasing amount of ETH. I know that the arguments for your proposed method are "reduced complexity", but it seems also to create technical debt.

author: catwith1hat
content: Ah looks like, I am thinking about EIP-4788 + withdrawal functionality in the deposit contract that would check withdrawal requests against the withdrawal list in the beacon state during the EVM execution.

author: ralexstokes
content: i think the risk of changing the deposit mechanism, which works, is too high relative to the cost of a few extra caveats to compute total supply

author: ralexstokes
content: i think there is even a PR to extend the execution APIs with a method “total supply” which would just encapsulate the calculation for you
